content.user_title: Master 2-Agent Workflow Between Cursor and Claude Code
content.value_statement: Struggling to coordinate work between Cursor and Claude Code? This skill provides clear guidance on the 2-agent workflow, helping PMs and workers collaborate effectively. Learn the exact commands, task management system, and handoff procedures for seamless project execution.
actual_capabilities: Explains 2-agent workflow between Cursor (PM) and Claude Code (Worker)
Details task management using Plans.md with status markers
Documents CI/CD rules and 3-failure retry policy
Shows real workflow examples with parallel task execution
limitations: Documentation-only skill - no active workflow automation
Requires manual implementation of commands and task management
Japanese language content may need translation for some users
Assumes specific project structure with Plans.md file

use_cases.title: Coordinate AI Agent Teams
use_cases.description: Learn how to assign tasks to Claude Code workers and manage project workflow efficiently using status markers and handoff procedures.

use_cases.title: Execute Tasks in 2-Agent System
use_cases.description: Understand your role as a worker agent, how to pick up tasks, implement solutions, and report completion back to PM.

use_cases.title: Implement Structured AI Collaboration
use_cases.description: Set up a robust 2-agent workflow system with clear role separation, task tracking, and quality control processes.

output_examples.input: How does the 2-agent workflow between Cursor and Claude Code work?

‚Ä¢ Claude Code (Worker): Executes implementation, runs tests, fixes CI failures (up to 3 attempts), and handles staging deployment
Workflow flow: PM creates tasks ‚Üí Worker executes ‚Üí Worker reports completion ‚Üí PM reviews and deploys

best_practices: Always use Plans.md for task tracking with proper status markers to maintain workflow visibility
Follow the 3-attempt CI failure rule - escalate to PM after 3 failed automatic fixes
Include clear task descriptions and acceptance criteria when creating new tasks
Use parallel execution for independent tasks to improve efficiency
anti_patterns: Don't skip the task documentation in Plans.md - it's essential for coordination
Avoid direct production deployments by Claude Code worker - this is PM's responsibility
Don't ignore CI failures or attempt unlimited fixes - follow the escalation process

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with all Claude Code versions?
faq.answer: Yes, this workflow guide works with all Claude Code versions that support custom commands and skills.

faq.question: What are the limitations of the 2-agent workflow?
faq.answer: The workflow requires manual setup of Plans.md and assumes both agents have access to the same repository.

faq.question: How do I integrate this with my existing project?
faq.answer: Initialize with /harness-init to create required files, then follow the workflow patterns documented in the skill.

faq.question: Is my project data safe during the workflow?
faq.answer: Yes, this is a documentation-only skill with no data access. Actual workflow execution depends on your Claude Code setup.

faq.question: What if CI keeps failing after 3 attempts?
faq.answer: Stop automatic fixes and escalate to PM. Document attempted solutions in the completion report for manual review.

faq.question: How does this compare to single-agent workflows?
faq.answer: 2-agent workflow provides better separation of concerns with dedicated PM for planning and worker for implementation.
